website_summaries.verdict: A solid, powerful tool that stands out for its impressive number of tools and rugged design. The best Leatherman has to offer.
pros: An extremely versatile model with 21 tools, including the brand's largest pliers and longest blades
Solid, reliable tools for a wide range of tasks
cons: The black finish is a bit oily at first, but this fades with use
It's costly, but you get a lot for the money

customer_reviews.title: Like the Original SuperTool but on steroids!
customer_reviews.text: So...This is one tough tool. It's like the original Supertool on steroids! The blade exchanger excepts T shank standard jigsaw blades which is really handy but changing the blades can be tough and risky without gloves because you have to push the lock back TOWARDS the blade after you change it. This is definitely a heavier multitool, not as heavy as my Leatherman MUT EOD but close. Finally sheath is cheep, would like to see a nice leather or MOLLE compatible sheath included at this price point, but the sheath does have to elastic loops on the side to hole a penlight, ferro rod, etc. Over all a solid well built tool. just very heavy!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Like new
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Surge in like new condition. Inspected. Dirty filthy full of crud. Missing bit, saw, and file. Main blade looked like someone has trying to cut co concrete. Had rust all over. Wasn't worth two Dead Flys. Sent it back and ordered a brand new one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Barkes

customer_reviews.title: Expectations were high, got defective scissors lock
customer_reviews.text: Update: Apr 23, 2020 Got the replacement from Amazon and the scissors works fine now. I cleaned up the black grease using an Ultrasonic Cleaner machine with a bit of soap. Applied WD40 for lubrication. -- Yet another beautiful and solid product from Leatherman! I own Sidekick and Wave Plus already and really excited about the latest Surge! Unfortunately the lock for the scissors got stuck and very difficult to engage. What's more, the spring loaded part doesn't work neither after scissors is deployed. I will probably have to return it to have it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Tools. Electro. DIY

customer_reviews.title: Best Leatherman Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is an essential part of my everyday carry. I have used a Leatherman tool ever since the first one but this is the best. Heavy. Strong. Capable. The scissors are invaluable and very precise. Strong pliers with very effective wire cutters...wire cutters that are replaceable if they ever get nicked. Super sharp saw blade. Effective serrated knife and straight knife. Advice: Get the leather pouch with the snap closure. Do not get the nylon pouch with the velcro closure. The leather pouch is much more durable.
customer_reviews.author: trapeze

customer_reviews.title: The Surge is a great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have used most of the tools on mine so far with no problems. I purchased the flat bit set and 1/4 inch bit extension however if I insert both flat bit holders behind the Surge, I cannot snap the cover. The pouch is good quality but it needs to be about 1/8 inch deeper to allow insertion of both flat screw bit holders and the extra files. Also, one of the elastic loops on the side should be a little tighter to prevent the 1/4 inch bit extender from falling out when the Surge is removed from the pouch. I purchased mine in Black Oxide and is holding up quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.  Comfortable handle on pliers, easy one handed operation.
customer_reviews.text: A couple things stood out to me with this and led to my decision to buy this model. The four tools on the outside of the handle being one, and the pliers themselves. Having the knife, serrated knife, scissors, and your choice of wood saw or metal file on the outside is super convenient. It makes the most common tools accessible with one hand. The pliers are longer than most other multi-tools and also a bit thinner. In my profession, I usually need pliers for more precise work rather than brute force. Finally, it goes without saying, you get the high quality of Leatherman.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best heavy duty multitool out there. Its simple and sleek while being very sturdy and useful. Has everything you could need and nothing you dont. I had one of these a few years ago and it was stolen. Just got another one and I have to stay the precsison and quality is even better than before. Only downside is the black finish needs to be cleaned before you use it. Then again taking some time to throughly clean and checking out your new favorite tool isnt exactly that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Broke day one of use
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened, it's been a while since I've had to buy a new Leatherman, and I didn't expect it to change in quality, but come on. I was putting together a Stand up desk; particleboard, basic office stuck, nothing heavy duty. During the process the screwdriver bit broke, I just opened and used the thing this morning after adding some CLP to clean and oil it up.

If would last that lost but gues we will find out in my future life lol

customer_reviews.title: It won't let you down
customer_reviews.text: Talk about a super tool. I do a lot when it comes to work. And this thing comes in handy. Everything is heavy duty and will not break on you the knives are super Sharp cuts through paper and cardboard like butter or any material... the product straight out of the box is going to be oily because that's how they keep the tool from stiffening up. it's going to be a little stiff for the first couple weeks until you get used to using it a lot and it loosens up. 25 year warranty on it prayer to get a lifetime anything breaks send it back there replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Daeson

customer_reviews.title: Like a toolbox on your belt
customer_reviews.text: I start a maintenance technician job in a factory in a few days. I bought this for quick fixes in a factory setting. Things like tightening a bolt or moving a sensor. I know this will far exceed my needs in that aspect and it's like a toolbox on my belt. I've used it around the house to put together a fire pit and cut through packaging. It's a great tool to carry with you around the house. I'm buying other accessories as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ploense

customer_reviews.title: Best multi tool I have ever gotten
customer_reviews.text: It’s heavy, but very good tool. Knife is sharp goes dull fast but it’s easy to sharpen so. I use it every day at work the finish is coming off but it’s a tool so not a big deal to me.... closing it watch out it will bite you and definitely gonna bleed lol

customer_reviews.title: Solid Multi-tool

Biggest waste of space on this knife. I used the little screw driver for a lot of things other than tightening eyeglasses. I wish y’all would’ve came up with something better than adding another prybar/ flat head in that area. Other than that this knife is one heck of a tool.

All the tools are currently stiff since it is a brand new tool but after using it more and more I could feel it getting looser and being easier to use. Word of advice: mine came covered in oil (for protection of the tool I imagine), I took a cloth to the areas I would be touching with my hand and wiped them clean.
customer_reviews.author: JMolina

At first, you should know it gives off a black residue, and also needs a good oiling. This is why I did not give it a full 5 stars. For the cost, it should already be lubed up and ready to go in my book. But, that's not a huge issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and capable
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. It's a little on the heavy side, but a ton lighter than my tool bag. I carry it with me all the time and use it several times a day. May be a bit excessive for occasional use, but a good fit for my life. The large pliers are substantially stronger/more capable than those of smaller tools, but still able to get in tight spaces. I really like that the knives and scissors are readily accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lost without it. Favorite Leatherman to date.
customer_reviews.text: I'd be a lost soul without my Leatherman, never leave home without one. This is my favorite one to date. I've owned several over the past 20+years and will personally attest to the time saved in avoiding the need to run to my toolbox both at home and while working. Although tools at end of one handle were loose when this one arrived (which I've since tightened) I'll own another Surge when this one goes mia or breaks.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: One tool, countless jobs accomplished.
customer_reviews.text: Not my first Leatherman but the first tool I grab for 90% of the daily fixers life calls for. It's amazing how versatile these things are. I don't consider myself the king of fixing things but between a few good tools and some YouTube videos there aren't many projects anyone can't learn how to tackle. The Leatherman Surge is worth its price. I'm thinking of buying a few more as gifts for my dad and brother.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Handy

customer_reviews.title: Can't leave home without it

Noticed my son carrying a leatherman that came in handy several times on the range. Looked over the models and this one seemed to fit my needs the best. I never leave home without it now. The Surge is heavy though. I can deal with that in order to have the tools that I need.
customer_reviews.author: Rdcress

customer_reviews.title: Most important tool to have in your arsenal
customer_reviews.text: I am a fruit farmer in rural Utah and I have put this thing through it’s paces. Anything from butchery to bolts this thing has done it all. I have used it to fix our cherry pitters, chains, and plumbing. As of right now. (August 2019) I have used it to cut countless 3/4 inch pvc pipes with the exchangeable saw blade which has held up very well. I would recommend buying the bit set that leather man makes. I have used the torx and Allen heads to fix my dirtbike so many times it isn’t funny. Definitely would buy again if it breaks but I won’t have to buy another because it has a lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and durable multitool

I cut through 120v wiring by mistake and damaged the wire cutting tool but have been able to get replacement blades. Good news is it cut right through with no issues... This is a very solid and durable multitool, the blades are super sharp and haven’t worn down yet after months of use. It was very stiff when I first got it but got better with use.

Other than normal wear and tear (I.e. from opening and closing the tool, dulling of the blade due to cutting hundreds if not thousands of objects, etc.), this leatherman has held up remarkably well. Needless to say, I would recommend this to others as a dependable tool.

Overall great product though!

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. I just wish it had an eyeglass ...

customer_reviews.title: I decided on this one and so far it's been great. I've been using Leatherman tools since I got ...

customer_reviews.title: You wont find a better multi-tool anywhere

Really love the range of functions on the Surge and I fully expect to have it till my dying days!

The knife blades (serrated) and fine are very sharp. I used the large scissors to open the plastic sealed package that held the pocket clip. As other reviews state you will get a black residue on your hands the first couple times you handle it, this is because all the tools are lubricated.

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
